content:
• Tuesday, July 9, 2013
  • ACPW

    Active Power (NASDAQ:ACPW) appoints Ake Almgren to serve as interim CEO and president. He...

    Active Power (NASDAQ:ACPW) appoints Ake Almgren to serve as interim CEO and president. He succeeds J. Douglas Milner who has resigned from the post, effective July 29, to pursue a new opportunity. Milner has also resigned as a member of the Board of Directors effective immediately. Shares -3.4% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:32 PM
  • FLY

    Fly Leasing (NYSE:FLY) -6.7% AH after announcing plans to offer up to $160M in American...

    Fly Leasing (NYSE:FLY) -6.7% AH after announcing plans to offer up to $160M in American depositary shares with proceeds expected to be used for general corporate purposes, including the acquisition of aircraft. The Dublin-based lessor of modern commercial jet aircraft recently had a market cap of ~$486M.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:01 PM
  • RH

    Restoration Hardware (NYSE:RH) launches a 12M share follow-on offering, with an option by the...

    Restoration Hardware (NYSE:RH) launches a 12M share follow-on offering, with an option by the underwriters to sell an additional 1.8M shares to cover overallotments, if any. All shares are to be sold by existing stockholders with no shares being sold by the company, nor will the company receive any proceeds from the sale. BAML and Goldman Sachs are joint book runners. Shares -1.3% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:00 PM
  • AMAT

    The sell-side is giving an enthusiastic thumbs-up to Applied Materials' (AMAT +3.4%) analyst day...

    The sell-side is giving an enthusiastic thumbs-up to Applied Materials' (AMAT +3.4%) analyst day forecasts. Piper is upbeat about the major incremental revenue opportunities related to chip equipment technologies such as epitaxial SiGe and metal deposition, and notes AMAT expects its display equipment sales to rise to ~$1B in FY16 from a current, depressed, $550M. Stifel expects the "increasing materials complexity" tied to the adoption of 3D transistors and NAND flash architectures to benefit AMAT, and Citi sees plenty of room for margin expansion. Shares +39% YTD and close to their 52-week high of $16.09.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:59 PM
  • NUS

    Other multi-level-marketers active on the back of Nu Skin's (NYSE:NUS) raised guidance:...

    Other multi-level-marketers active on the back of Nu Skin's (NYSE:NUS) raised guidance: Herbalife (NYSE:HLF) +2.3%, USANA (NYSE:USNA) +0.6%, Blyth (NYSE:BTH) +0.3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:42 PM
  • NUS

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: NUS +7%. HLF +3%. HELE +2%. GOGO +2%. OSTK +2%....

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: NUS +7%. HLF +3%. HELE +2%. GOGO +2%. OSTK +2%.
    After-hours top losers: FLY -7%. KYN -5%. OPEN -4%. EXP -3%. INSY -2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:30 PM
  • NUS

    Nu Skin (NYSE:NUS) ups guidance for Q2 significantly. Revenue is now estimated to be about...

    Nu Skin (NYSE:NUS) ups guidance for Q2 significantly. Revenue is now estimated to be about $680M, with an EPS of approximately $1.20. Prior guidance was for revenue of around $570M to $580M, with EPS guidance between $0.91 to $0.95. Street estimates are for an EPS of $0.96 on revenue of $579.1M. The company is also increasing its FY13 EPS and revenue guidance by $320M, now expecting to earn between $4.85 to $5.00 per share on revenue of $2.83B to $2.86B. Consensus estimates for FY13 are for an EPS of $4.29 on revenue of $2.54B. Shares +9.8% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:20 PM | 1 Comment
  • ASTI

    Ascent Solar (OTC:ASTI) +10.5% AH on news it's building a Chinese plant to make thin-film solar...

    Ascent Solar (OTC:ASTI) +10.5% AH on news it's building a Chinese plant to make thin-film solar modules for use in its EnerPlex accessory line, courtesy of a JV with the government of the city of Suqian. Ascent, which will have a majority stake of "up to 80%," will contribute its IP, $1.6M, and equipment, and the government will provide $32.5M and rent-free use of a 270K sq. foot facility (expandable to 1M). The JV is also being given a "multi-year corporate tax holiday" and other perks, and Ascent will have the right to buy the plant at construction cost at any time in the first 5 years. The project is set to have 3 phases spread out over 6 years.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:54 PM | 3 Comments
  • YELP

    Yelp (YELP +6.7%) jumps to new highs after announcing it's no longer a mere ad-seller: the local...

    Yelp (YELP +6.7%) jumps to new highs after announcing it's no longer a mere ad-seller: the local reviews leader is launching a platform that allows local businesses to take orders and have transactions processed on its site/apps. Only food delivery/pickup orders are initially supported, but Yelp promises "categories like spas, yoga studios, salons and dentist appointments" will launch in the coming months. Yelp's efforts present new competition for Groupon (GRPN -3.3%), which has been working hard to expand beyond daily deals and become a broader local e-commerce enabler.Â  Google (NASDAQ:GOOG) is also eying this market.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:11 PM | 1 Comment
  • HELE

    Helen of Troy (NASDAQ:HELE): Q1 EPS of $0.82 beats by $0.11. Revenue of $304.5M beats by $3.M....

    Helen of Troy (NASDAQ:HELE): Q1 EPS of $0.82 beats by $0.11. Revenue of $304.5M beats by $3.M. Shares +3.1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:09 PM
  • NBR

    Nabors Industries (NYSE:NBR) warns that its Q2 will come in below estimates. Operating Income is...

    Nabors Industries (NYSE:NBR) warns that its Q2 will come in below estimates. Operating Income is projected to be in the range of $88M to $91M, with the shortfall most pronounced in its Rig Services and Completion and Production Services lines. The firm cites lower sales of capital equipment and reduced service and rental activity for the miss, along with adverse weather and intense competition, particularly for pressure pumping in the U.S. and Canada. Shares -4% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:07 PM | 3 Comments
  • ET

    Barclays views Energy Transfer Equity (ETE +4%) as attractively priced but not yet reflecting...

    Barclays views Energy Transfer Equity (ETE +4%) as attractively priced but not yet reflecting potential near-term catalysts which could add another $12-$13/unit. As a pure play GP with no funding burden, the firm sees ETE's trading yield of 4.3% as attractive vs. a number of LPs with mid-teens growth profiles. The firm maintains its $72 price target while raising its upside case to $85.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:49 PM
  • HMA

    More on the takeover rumors that have shares of Health Management Associates (HMA +8.1%) moving...

    More on the takeover rumors that have shares of Health Management Associates (HMA +8.1%) moving sharply to the upside in afternoon trading: Community Health Systems (CYH +3.9%) is the most likely buyer, sources tell Reuters, although HCA Holdings (HCA +1%) and LifePoint Hospitals (LPNT +3.3%) are also mentioned as interested parties.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:45 PM
  • ISRG

    Wedbush's Tao Levy says Intuitive Surgical's (ISRG -16.9%) Q2 shortfall could be tied to delayed...

    Wedbush's Tao Levy says Intuitive Surgical's (ISRG -16.9%) Q2 shortfall could be tied to delayed spending ahead of Obamacare-related changes. "We have been hearing that some hospitals have been delaying non-essential capital equipment purchases pending greater visibility regarding the effect of Obamacare next year," Levy says, "which would imply at least a couple more quarters of difficult U.S. system placements." The firm maintains an Outperform on the shares, but lowers its price target to $520 from $580.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:28 PM | 2 Comments
  • CSX

    Railroad stocks move higher with M&A chatter in the sector picking up again and more...

    Railroad stocks move higher with M&A chatter in the sector picking up again and more forecasts out that supply chain managers will have a bigger incentive to move freight by train instead of trucks in the near future. Advancers: CSX +3.5%, GWR +3.3%, UNP +2.2%, NSC +1.9%, CP +1.7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:48 PM
  • AGN

    Allergan (AGN +1.8%) ticks higher today on speculation that recent weakness in the stock could...

    Allergan (AGN +1.8%) ticks higher today on speculation that recent weakness in the stock could lead to a potential takeover. The shares have dipped by 28% since mid-April on concerns over delays in drug studies and generic competition. But AGN could be a good fit for the likes of a GlaxoSmithKline (GSK,), who already licenses Botox from AGN, or Merck (NYSE:MRK), who produces comparable eye-care products. Leerink Swann notes also that Nestle (OTCPK:NSRGY) could be a good fit for merging its skin-care business.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:48 PM
  • THOR-OLD

    Share of Thoratec (THOR-OLD -2.7%) are sliding today and activity in the options market shows...

    Share of Thoratec (THOR-OLD -2.7%) are sliding today and activity in the options market shows some traders betting the shares will remain under pressure over the near-term. Volume in the August $31 strike puts is 20 times open interest currently and puts outnumbered calls 35-to-1 as of noon. The stock has yet to recover from a post-earnings drubbing in early May.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:41 PM
  • TMUS

    T-Mobile USA (TMUS +4.2%) spikes higher as Bloomberg reports the company will announce at...

    T-Mobile USA (TMUS +4.2%) spikes higher as Bloomberg reports the company will announce at tomorrow's annual meeting it added postpaid subs in Q2, breaking a long string of sub losses months ahead of plan. T-Mobile's iPhone 5 launch is undoubtedly a big reason why; Kantar Worldpanel thinks the launch helped the iPhone's U.S. share rise 350 bps Y/Y to 41.9% in the March-May period.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:38 PM | 1 Comment
  • LRCX

    Lam Research (LRCX +2.5%) jumps as the company provides upbeat analyst day commentary (webcast)....

    Lam Research (LRCX +2.5%) jumps as the company provides upbeat analyst day commentary (webcast). Lam expects the wafer fab equipment market will be worth ~$30B this year, that its value will grow to $35B-$40B in the 2016 timeframe, and that it currently has a 26% share; Garther thinks the market will be worth $28B this year, and $37.8B in 2015. The chip equipment maker's comments follow bullish remarks made yesterday afternoon by rival Applied Materials during its analyst day.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:20 PM
  • NX

    Quanex Building Products (NX -1.8%) dips today after naming William C. Griffiths as chairman,...

    Quanex Building Products (NX -1.8%) dips today after naming William C. Griffiths as chairman, president and CEO late yesterday. Griffiths replaces David D. Petratis who resigned to accept a position with another company.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:13 PM
  • HMA

    Health Management Associates (HMA +6.9%) spikes midday on continued takeover chatter. (Previous:...

    Health Management Associates (HMA +6.9%) spikes midday on continued takeover chatter. (Previous: I, II, III)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:11 PM
  • WG

    In a delayed reaction, Willbros (WG +10.6%) surges higher a day after announcing a term loan...

    In a delayed reaction, Willbros (WG +10.6%) surges higher a day after announcing a term loan refi which would extend its closest debt maturity by four years and improve its liquidity position. Moody's raised its outlook on WG's B3 junk rating to stable from negative on expectations the company will complete the refi and that operating performance will remain stable in the next 12-18 months.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:09 PM
  • PBH

    Prestige Brands (PBH +11.1%) gets an upgrade to Buy from Neutral at Sidoti and is initiated at...

    Prestige Brands (PBH +11.1%) gets an upgrade to Buy from Neutral at Sidoti and is initiated at B. Riley with a Buy rating and a $38 price target representing a 13% upside on top of today's double-digit gains. (Earlier: PBH acquires Care Pharmaceuticals)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:02 PM
  • QTWW

    Quantum Fuel Systems (QTWW +4.7%) gets a boost after saying it's received an order for its...

    Quantum Fuel Systems (QTWW +4.7%) gets a boost after saying it's received an order for its Q-Lite compressed natural gas storage vessels from an undisclosed customer with "broad industry reach." The company says the contract highlights its expansion into the surging CNG after-market segment in the central part of the United States, and particularly broadens its market reach into natural gas-rich Texas and the Mid-West region.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:43 PM | 2 Comments
  • CGA

    China Green Agriculture (CGA -1.2%) its subsidiary, Shaanxi TechTeam Jinong Humic Acid Product...

    China Green Agriculture (CGA -1.2%) its subsidiary, Shaanxi TechTeam Jinong Humic Acid Product Company, has signed a 5-year cooperation agreement with an agricultural material coop in Zhejiang province, which has been a major distributor of Jinong's roots boost product. Sales of Jinong's roots boost product to the dealer are expected to grow 30X per annum by FY17 when compared to this year.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:36 PM | 4 Comments
  • FIVE

    Credit Suisse hikes its price target on Five Below (FIVE +1.8%)  to $43 from $37 citing...

    Credit Suisse hikes its price target on Five Below (FIVE +1.8%)Â  to $43 from $37 citing "impressive comp performance." Analyst Christian Buss says that the company's "merchandising and assortment planning" have given it a competitive advantage over rivals but cautions that at 42x FY14 estimates, valuation may be a concern.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:34 PM
  • FSL

    More on Piper's upgrade of Freescale (FSL +10.6%): Analyst Gus Richard is raising his revenue...

    More on Piper's upgrade of Freescale (FSL +10.6%): Analyst Gus Richard is raising his revenue and gross margin forecasts, citing expectations of higher fab utilization and a bigger mix of high-margin RF/networking chip sales. He also thinks Freescale's efforts to restructure its debt/lower interest expense could yield additional EPS upside. Thanks to its P-E legacy, Freescale had $6.4B in debt on its balance sheet as of March 28, to go with $767M in cash. Shares +74% since Gregg Lowe was named CEO in June '12.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:24 PM | 3 Comments
  • ROYT

    Pacific Coast Oil Trust (ROYT -3.8%) tumbles after a bearish note from Hedgeye's Kevin Kasier -...

    Pacific Coast Oil Trust (ROYT -3.8%) tumbles after a bearish note from Hedgeye's Kevin Kasier - who's been notably sour on upstream MLPs like Linn Energy and Breitburn. Kaiser also reiterates his short of Breitburn (BBEP +4.6%), but the bulls are winning the battle today, with disclosure of more insider buys maybe helping.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:22 PM | 1 Comment
  • INO

    Inovio Pharmaceuticals (INO +9%) tacks on another big gain today after the company reported...

    Inovio Pharmaceuticals (INO +9%) tacks on another big gain today after the company reported Tuesday that a preclinical study showed that 100% of animals vaccinated with its influenza DNA vaccine were protected against the newly emergent H7N9 flu virus. The results demonstrated that INO's vaccine generated not only hemagglutination inhibition-based protection, but also strong T-cell responses that could reduce the severity of the infection in those infected and limit the spread of the virus in a pandemic setting.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:00 PM | 3 Comments
  • BBEPQ

    Breitburn Energy Partners' (BBEP +4.6%) CFO and an executive VP bought a combined 26K shares on...

    Breitburn Energy Partners' (BBEP +4.6%) CFO and an executive VP bought a combined 26K shares on July 5 at $15.07-$15.28 worth ~$400K (I, II). The purchases follow another insider buy from CEO Halbert Washburn, who reported buying 30K shares at $14.68-$14.92 on July 3, worth ~$450K.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:59 PM | 4 Comments
  • EVAC

    Edwards Group (EVAC +3.7%) trades higher after the company ups its guidance for Q2, now seeing...

    Edwards Group (EVAC +3.7%) trades higher after the company ups its guidance for Q2, now seeing revenue of Â£162M - Â£164M ($242.27M - $245.26M), up from the prior outlook range of Â£145 - Â£160M ($216.85M - $239.28M). Analysts were looking for Â£152.13M ($227.51). Adjusted net income is now anticipated to be well above the previous guidance of Â£12M - Â£15M ($17.95M - $22.43M).

     
     
     
     
    | 12:52 PM
  • FB

    Facebook (FB +2.5%) ad checks "came back slightly more upbeat than in 1Q," says Deutsche's Ross...

    Facebook (FB +2.5%) ad checks "came back slightly more upbeat than in 1Q," says Deutsche's Ross Sandler while reiterating a Buy and $37 PT. International is said to be responsible for most of the strength, but Sandler thinks U.S. ad growth "may also tick up a bit in 2Q." Sandler also estimates just ~2% of Facebook's mobile impressions drive 30% of its mobile revenue, which suggests there's "plenty of runway" for growth. Facebook's international ARPUs remain well below its North American ARPU, even for Europe. The company has been investing heavily in its international sales ops to help narrow that gap. (Deutsche's Jan. upgrade)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:48 PM
  • DOLNQ

    Midday top 10 gainers: DM +29%. CREG +23%. CYTR +21%. AEHR +16%. LCNB +15%. HDY +13%. SGYP +12%....

    Midday top 10 gainers: DM +29%. CREG +23%. CYTR +21%. AEHR +16%. LCNB +15%. HDY +13%. SGYP +12%. WG +12%. PBH +12%. AMBT +12%.
    Midday top 10 Losers: XXIA -19%. ISRG -18%. FXEN -14%. PBMD -13%. SNCR -11%. ORMP -11%. LUNA -9%. AMRN -8%. CSIQ -8%. CRMD -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM
  • GPK

    Graphic Packaging (NYSE:GPK) gets a boost today from Longbow Research, who initiates coverage on...

    Graphic Packaging (NYSE:GPK) gets a boost today from Longbow Research, who initiates coverage on the shares with a Buy rating and a price target of $10 per share.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:41 PM
  • RBS

    "Could a bad bank be a good thing," asks Goldman, adding Royal Bank of Scotland (RBS +5.7%) to...

    "Could a bad bank be a good thing," asks Goldman, adding Royal Bank of Scotland (RBS +5.7%) to its Buy list amid reports the U.K. is considering splitting the lender into good and bad banks. The split, says Goldman, would pretty much turn "good" RBS into a domestic retail lender, with trading making up less than 10% of earnings and U.K. retail business generating about 75%.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:41 PM
  • ONVO

    Shares of Organovo (ONVO +20.9%) soar after the company announces that it's been approved...

    Shares of OrganovoÂ (ONVO +20.9%) soar after the company announces that it's been approved for listing on the NYSE, where it will begin trading on July 11 under the symbol "ONVO".Â The company will withdraw its shares from listing on the OTCQX concurrent with its listing on the NYSE.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:32 PM | 2 Comments
  • CHEF

    Shares of Chef's Warehouse (CHEF +2%) enjoy a strong session. Perhaps helping the stock's cause...

    Shares of Chef's Warehouse (CHEF +2%) enjoy a strong session. Perhaps helping the stock's cause is SA Pro contributor Pendulum's bullish article which came out of embargo today. The stock could see gains of 60% over the next 1-2 years, Pendulum says, citing a number of catalysts including underappreciated acquisitions and a "compelling valuation" compared to a big name peer.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:47 AM
  • AABA

    Checks indicate Yahoo's (YHOO +2.8%) ad sales have been bolstered by modest inventory growth and...

    Checks indicate Yahoo's (YHOO +2.8%) ad sales have been bolstered by modest inventory growth and improvement in revenue/search, trends that are offsetting continued price pressure in the display ad market, says Goldman's Heath Terry in a note that appears to be lifting shares. Expectations for Yahoo's search and (especially) display ad sales are low following a weak Q1. Terry, who maintains a Buy and $30 PT, forecasts Q2 revenue of $1.079B and adjusted EBITDA (lifted by cost savings) of $376M vs. a consensus of $1.082B and $369M.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:39 AM
  • AMRN

    Amarin (AMRN -8.3%) slides after its equity offering reportedly prices at $5.75, a 6.8% discount...

    Amarin (AMRN -8.3%) slides after its equity offering reportedly prices at $5.75, a 6.8% discount to Monday's close. (Also: AMRN talks Vascepa sales)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:37 AM | 2 Comments
  • KGC

    Get ready for a turbulent earnings season for gold producers, as Stifel Nicolaus warns that...

    Get ready for a turbulent earnings season for gold producers, as Stifel Nicolaus warns that miners it follows will report an average 20% Q/Q drop in EBITDA. Kinross Gold (KGC +0.4%), Barrick Gold (ABX +2.4%) and Newmont Mining (NEM +0.4%) are seen as losing well over 30% of their production from mine closures; Goldcorp (GG +3.1%) would lose only 7% because of its low-cost asset base. (also)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:32 AM | 5 Comments
  • AMBT

    Shares of Ambient (AMBT +11%) pop after Consolidated Edison (NYSE:ED) contracts the company to...

    Shares of Ambient (AMBT +11%) pop after Consolidated Edison (NYSE:ED) contracts the company to provide application development and communications equipment to replace discontinued technology for its commercial and industrial metering. AMBT already completed a year of testing and a successful pilot program prior to being granted the contract.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:26 AM
  • BB

    As expected, all of BlackBerry's (BBRY +3.8%) directors were re-elected at the company's annual...

    As expected, all of BlackBerry's (BBRY +3.8%) directors were re-elected at the company's annual meeting. BlackBerry also announced there are now 120K BB10 apps available (up from 100K in March), and that 60K users are beta-testing BBM Channels. Shares are rallying, but remain below $10 for now.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:26 AM | 11 Comments
  • DQ

    Daqo New Energy (DQ -6.1%) adds to yesterday's losses, falling sharply on heavy volume. The...

    Daqo New Energy (DQ -6.1%) adds to yesterday's losses, falling sharply on heavy volume. The two-day sell-off now totals some 25%. (Previous: DQ plummets, China opts to forgo import duties)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:10 AM
  • UPS

    Shares of UPS (UPS +2.2%) ride the coattails of FedEx higher without any direct news on the...

    Shares of UPS (UPS +2.2%) ride the coattails of FedEx higher without any direct news on the company out. With the significant help of the air freight stocks, the Dow Jones Transports (IYT +2.5%) ETF is having itself a nice little day.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:10 AM
  • CSIQ

    Canadian Solar (CSIQ -9.8%) dives as auditor Deloitte's bookkeeping comes under fire in an SEC...

    Canadian Solar (CSIQ -9.8%) dives as auditor Deloitte's bookkeeping comes under fire in an SEC hearing aimed at convincing a judge to sanction the Chinese arms of the world's top-5 accounting firms for refusing to hand over audit papers. Deloitte was questioned in detail yesterday over its audit work for CSIQ, whose accounting the SEC has been investigating since 2010. Shares still +226% YTD.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:08 AM
  • DGX

    Quest Diagnostics (DGX -4.5%) slips on concerns over lower reimbursement rates from Medicare and...

    Quest Diagnostics (DGX -4.5%) slips on concerns over lower reimbursement rates from Medicare and a downgrade at Morgan Stanley to Underweight. The firm says that CMS' proposal to lower reimbursement rates for lab tests covered under the Physician Fee Schedule is deeper than expected, and negatively affects its prior model forecasts.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:07 AM
  • FDX

    FedEx (FDX +6.4%) shoots higher with reports out that it settled a lawsuit in which it was...

    FedEx (FDX +6.4%) shoots higher with reports out that it settled a lawsuit in which it was alleged the company was overcharging customers for years. Also in the background on any mid-day spike is the speculation over which large-cap stock Bill Ackman will be buying up.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:57 AM
  • P

    Pandora (P -4.9%) gives back some of its recent gains after releasing its June audience metrics,...

    Pandora (P -4.9%) gives back some of its recent gains after releasing its June audience metrics, which suggest its mobile listening cap is still taking a toll. Pandora's U.S. radio listening share was 7.04%, up from 5.98% a year ago, but down from May's 7.29%, April's 7.33%, and March's 8.05%. Listener hours totaled 1.25B, +17% Y/Y but -7% M/M (can't fully be explained by one less day). Active listeners rose by less than 1% M/M, and 30% Y/Y, to 71.1M. Also: 1) Pandora has updated its iOS apps to feature improved buffering and auto-pause. 2) High-end headphone maker Beats is reportedly thinking of launching a subscription streaming service with AT&T. Shares made new 52-week highs yesterday.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:45 AM | 1 Comment
  • GOLD

    After sliding 61% YTD, Stifel Nicolaus gets around to downgrading Barrick Gold (ABX +2.6%)...

    After sliding 61%Â YTD, Stifel Nicolaus gets around to downgrading Barrick Gold (ABX +2.6%) to Hold from Buy. The firm admits it should have moved sooner but expected a gold price bounce to allow a better exit price; the risks of continuing to wait could outweigh the rewards since it now expects gold to go lower before recovering in 6-12 months. The firm says ABX’s fortunes are linked to gold prices more than peers.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:29 AM | 3 Comments
  • UNXL

    UniPixel (UNXL -5.1%) slumps after announcing a class-action suit filed against the company in...

    UniPixel (UNXL -5.1%) slumps after announcing a class-action suit filed against the company in the Southern District of New York has been voluntarily dismissed by the plaintiff. A class-action filed in the Southern District of Texas remains outstanding. Both suits have alleged UniPixel's management violated securities laws by providing false/misleading statements about the company's products and licensing deals. (PR) (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:15 AM | 12 Comments
  • BKS

    Barnes & Noble (BKS +3.1%) says it has no "immediate plans" to name a new CEO to replace...

    Barnes & Noble (BKS +3.1%) says it has no "immediate plans" to name a new CEO to replace William Lynch, a development that isn't disturbing investors this morning as shares recover from a premarket drop. The new focus on the company turns to if Leonard Riggio can grab control of the bookstore business and how to line up a Nook exit or transformation with investors Pearson and Microsoft still in the mix.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:14 AM
  • SODA

    Shares of SodaStream (SODA -3.6%) lose a little of their pop in early trading as the...

    Shares of SodaStream (SODA -3.6%) lose a little of their pop in early trading as the Coca-Cola/PepsiCo takeover premium is peeled back. The debate on SodaStream is as lively as ever, but the more grounded analysis suggests the company is in the early innings of its broad expansion plan with questions on where the ceiling on demand is still unanswered.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:58 AM | 6 Comments
  • RIO

    The first convoy of trucks has left Rio Tinto's (RIO +2.1%) Oyu Tolgoi mine in Mongolia carrying...

    The first convoy of trucks has left Rio Tinto's (RIO +2.1%) Oyu Tolgoi mine in Mongolia carrying copper to China, an important milestone for the operation and a sign government frustrations over cost and financing have eased since the incumbent president won a new term in office. RIO says all permits are in place and the operation has approval to continue selling copper concentrate. TRQ +3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:47 AM | 1 Comment

    Egypt's EGX 30 stock index is +2.2% after interim President Adly Mansour yesterday laid out a faster-than-expected timetable for new elections. Parliament will vote on an amended constitution within five months, with parliamentary and presidential votes due early next year.
